Chapter 21
Review of Deep Learning Models for
Human Activity Recognition
Human activity recognition, or HAR, is a challenging time series classiﬁcation task. It involves
predicting the movement of a person based on sensor data and traditionally involves deep
domain expertise and methods from signal processing to correctly engineer features from the
raw data in order to ﬁt a machine learning model. Recently, deep learning methods such as
